pr_title: AuditLog: Refactor to use AuditCategory enum

timeline.bodyText: My understanding is that not all AuditCategory applies to Rest or Transport categories. It may be good to log a warning if an admin tries to disable auditing for a category that does not apply. Note that this case is different from an invalid category.
timeline.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: Maybe raise another issue for this?
replies.author: sujithvm

timeline.bodyText: I'd recommend start deprecating "NONE" as a setting and log a warning. It is easy to use "none" instead of "NONE" especially that category names are case-insensitive.
timeline.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: Then it should complain and throw exception. It is documented to use NONE https://opendistro.github.io/for-elasticsearch-docs/docs/security-audit-logs/#exclude-categories
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: OK, I'll file an issue and see what others think.
replies.author: vrozov

timeline.bodyText: nit: as you are constructing an empty EnumSet directly here, add disabledRestCategoriesList.isEmpty() condition.
timeline.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText:
Do you mean disabledRestCategoriesList.isEmpty() || disabledRestCategoriesList.size() == 1 && "NONE".equalsIgnoreCase(disabledRestCategoriesList.get(0)) ?
Is it not redundant? as it will go to else and build an empty set.
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: It is not redundant, but, yes, the end result is the same. Question is if you short-circuit call to parse() when disabledRestCategoriesList is implicitly empty, why is it not short-circuited when it is explicitly empty?
replies.author: vrozov

timeline.bodyText: Is it necessary to allow null? Should it check for an empty collection and throw NullPointerException?
timeline.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText: I don't think so. As far as this parse is concerned, absence of values in input (whether null || empty) should mean no output categories.
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: While you may handle null the same way as an empty collection, the parse() function itself follows "prefer empty collection over null" and converts null to an empty set.
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText:
I didnt quite follow you.
If we have an input list of nulls, since we are filtering non-nulls in the stream we would return empty set.
This is what I meant by absence of values and we are return an empty set. [null, null...] = null => return empty set.
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText:
What if the collection categories itself is null? When I referred to "check for an empty collection" I meant instead of if (categories == null), check if (categories.isEmpty()).
You brought a good question, how null should be handled inside the collection. IMO, that is a programming mistake to pass null inside the categories collection.
replies.author: vrozov

replies.bodyText:
Are you saying to short-circuit if (categories == null || categories.isEmpty())  ?
I mean to say, absence of values whether categories is null or empty or list of only null strings should all mean the same thing -> empty category set.
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: @vrozov If you could tell exactly the change you are looking for, i could can do that and move on. I don't want to be blocked with such issues.
replies.author: sujithvm

replies.bodyText: My suggestion is not to allow null at all, whether the collection itself is null or it contains null. Change if (categores == null) to if (categories.isEmpty()) and remove the filter.
replies.author: vrozov
